page.title: 18HAMS HALL POWER STATION
page.content: The site for the Power Station was bought from the Adderley Family in 1919. Work began on the first Power Station in 1926 & was finished just before the Second World War. This was known as Station A. A Second Station (B) was completed in 1949 & in 1958 Station C made Hams Hall the largest power generating site in Europe. Now, however, only C Station remains functional. The Power Station is coal-fired & during the long coal strike which began in 1984 the station continued producing electricity. The CEGB Central Workshops for the Midlands, National Technical Training Centre, National Training Resource Centre, Hydraulic-Calibration Unit & Non-Destructive Testing Centre are also on the 1000 acre site.
